newsitem.title: UK: Med oil products soften, look to Asia for support.
newsitem.headline: Med oil products soften, look to Asia for support.

text.p: Mediterranean oil products were softer on Thursday in an unhurried market, with Asian sellng chances the only major factor, traders said.
Naphtha was easier but found some support in buying interest for arbitrage to the Far East.
"The arbitrage may be possible and makes a better alternative when weighed against European demand, but it's not as good as it was last month," a trader said.
Outright prices were notionally assessed around $1-2 lower at $176/$179 a tonne cif.
Gasoline was supported at the lower levels by buying into Italy, the East Med and the Black Sea.

However buying was fairly relaxed and there was plenty of product in Italy to cover local needs. Premium unleaded cargoes for balance of April delivery talked around fob high quotes +$2 a tonne, equivalent to around $197 fob Med.
Gas oil premiums held firm on the back of continued Asian interest which was keeping Italian 0.2 pct around fob high quotes +$3-5.
Sought after Russian "arb" cargoes were looking for high fob quotes +$4. A large cargo available out of the Black Sea on 25-30 dates was likely to be sold on Friday or early next week.
High sulphur fuel oil suffered from poor demand and ample supply, with traders weighing the profitability of taking material east.
A German trader was heard to have bought 50kt of end-April Italian barrels, for high quotes plus 25 cents or $1, possibly to take to Asia. But notional values held at around $88/$89 fob.
"The numbers are still the same but the next deal you'll see will be significantly lower," a trader said.
Low sulphur was talked slightly weaker with no business seen.
